question: Can I afford a mortgage on a house worth $300,000 with an annual income of $80,000 and a credit score of 680?
true_answer: Yes, with a credit score of 680 and DTI of 28%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment typically 5-20%.

steps.content: Can I afford a mortgage on a house worth $300,000 with an annual income of $80,000 and a credit score of 680?
Plan: 1) Consult home_loan_agent for affordability criteria. 2) Consider credit score with credit_agent. 3) Calculate DTI. 4) Review with supervisor_agent. 5) Deliver final answer.
Retrieving information on mortgage affordability criteria.
Affordability typically requires a debt-to-income ratio below 36%.
Credit score check: 680 is above the typical 620 minimum, considered good.
Calculating debt-to-income ratio with given annual income and estimated monthly debts.
DTI calculated as 28%, which is within the affordable range.
Do I need to consider any specific down payment?
Retrieving information on down payment norms.
Down payment typically ranges from 5-20% depending on the loan type.
Reviewing all collected information for consistency and correctness.
All information verified and correct. User can afford the mortgage.
Summarize findings and prepare to deliver final answer to user.
Yes, with a credit score of 680 and DTI of 28%, you can afford the mortgage. Down payment typically 5-20%.
